div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 12:53 pm CDT

div.div: Mostly sunny, with a high near 62. Northeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.
A slight chance of rain after 5am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 41. Northeast wind 5 to 9 mph becoming calm after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 10%.

A chance of rain, mainly between 8am and 2pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 66. Light and variable wind becoming west northwest 9 to 14 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 12:53 pm CDT

div.div: Mostly sunny, with a high near 62. Northeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.
A slight chance of rain after 5am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 41. Northeast wind 5 to 9 mph becoming calm after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 10%.

A chance of rain, mainly between 8am and 2pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 66. Light and variable wind becoming west northwest 9 to 14 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

div.p: Students, Staff, and parents if you need technology assistance, please feel to reach out to the Technology Dept. at USD 429. We are here to help you!

a.aria-label: Read more about Technology Assistance for Students

div.p: Student fees for the 2020-21 school year were approved by the USD 429 Board of Education at the April 6, 2020 Board of Education Meeting. Enrollment for the 20-21 school year will be August 6, 2020. Enrollment packets will be mailed out on May 1st! Please be watching for these. We have spent time during this school year, condensing down the enrollment packet. We will be opening the online parent portal for you to make payments toward enrollment after May 20th! So you will be able to have all your enrollment paid if you would like before enrollment on August 6th. Again be looking for those enrollment packets that will be mailed on May 1st!

a.aria-label: Read more about 20-21 USD 429 Troy Student Fees

div.p:
Troy High School yearbook ordering information.
If you need any assistance, please feel free to email Mr. Fallaha at sfallaha@troyusd.org or call the central office at 785-985-3950. Thank you.
Here is the link for ordering a yearbook.
They (Parents/Students) will also need to type in this numeric code to purchase a yearbook: 3720

a.aria-label: Read more about Troy High School Yearbook Order

h3.a: USD 429 Troy will be Adding Breakfast to Free Meal Service on March 30th

div.p: USD 429 Troy will be adding breakfast to our free meal program starting today (March 30, 2020). Please call 785-985-3950 between 8 - 10 am to order your lunch. We will be handing out a breakfast for the next morning with the lunch pickup starting on Monday, March 30, 2020. Lunch menu for Monday is Chicken Patty on Bun. Pickup times are 11 a.m. - Noon behind Troy High School at 319 S Park. Per federal regulations, all children receiving the free meal (children ages 1-18) need to be in the car at pick up.

a.aria-label: Read more about USD 429 Troy will be Adding Breakfast to Free Meal Service on March 30th

h3.a: From the Desk of Patrick McKernan

span.span: We have never expected more out of you then we are expecting now. Our staff will practice patience, flexibility, grace as we work through the upcoming challenging week. We want and need to help you through this. As stated previously we will not have any students onsite from March 30-April 3. I do not see those restrictions being lifted at this time, but I am not going to paint us or myself in a corner with definitive yes or no guidelines. I would love to finish school in a building with your kids in a classroom with our teachers, shaking seniors hands as they walk across the stage. I continue to have hope this will happen.

Teacher/Parent Communication – We should be knocking this out the park right now. If you have not heard from the school or your child’s teachers, please email me personally as I want to make sure I answer any questions you have. If you have concerns, don’t blow up Facebook as we might not see it! Email Mr. Estes mestes@troyusd.org or me pmckernan@troyusd.org. You can also Zoom or call us, we are here at the school. We will make sure you get the communication addresses and information you need to contact us.

Building access – Our buildings are not shut down, which is why many teachers have worked from the buildings this week, following the ten and under rule and social distancing. Some staff may teach from their classrooms. We are shut down to outside visitors and students until further notice.

Scammers – If you get anything asking for any information, that has not come from us, your child’s teachers, or a trusted USD 429 account, don’t click. We will communicate with you if a vendor, textbook resources, teacher, the school etc. is asking for administration.

Internet Issues – We have been tirelessly working on this with internet providers. We are not close yet in finding solutions for those that do not have internet or access to internet. If you live in town and have internet, could you share with the neighbor? These are private and personal decisions that only you can make.
Hotspots – Have been established at the Troy ballfield and the Troy library. If you bring your laptop to any of our buildings you can gain access to our district wifi automatically.

I will update the social media sites when I have additional information to share with you. I would like to say takeoff, the flight, and the landing are all going to be smooth. We know it might be bumpy for all of us. Hang in there with us. And tell your kids hello for us, we certainly do miss them.

a.aria-label: Read more about From the Desk of Patrick McKernan

span.span: Troy Schools Kindergarten Round-Up that was scheduled for April 3rd has been postponed indefinitely. We will be in touch as the current situation continues to unfold and we find a new plan. Please continue to read the schools Facebook page and the website, www.troyusd.org for any updated information about this event.

a.aria-label: Read more about Kindergarten Round Up Information Updated
